definition: Central Party School, China's highest institution specifically for training Party cadres, founded in 1933

sentences.english: And with the CPC Shanghai Municipal FINANCE COMMITTEE.
sentences.chinese: 并设有中共上海市财贸党校。

sentences.english: Southwest Jiaotong University, Emei Campus 36th Party Schools talented students.
sentences.chinese: 西南交大大年夜峨眉校区第三十六期党校优良学员。

sentences.english: He graduated from Hunan Provincial Party College in 1992.
sentences.chinese: 1992年于湖南省委党校大学专科毕业。

sentences.english: Carry on the intercollegiate exchange is the important link to run the party school.
sentences.chinese: 校际交流是办好党校的重要环节。

sentences.english: He graduated from the Party School in 1998 after majoring in Marxist philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 1998年党校毕业，主修马克思主义哲学。

sentences.english: As this term of the Party School begins, the rectification movement is commencing throughout the Taihang area.
sentences.chinese: 在这次党校开学的同时，全太行区开始整风运动。

sentences.english: Journal of Party College of Sichuan Province …
sentences.chinese: 中共四川省委党校学报。

sentences.english: Teaching quality is the lifeblood of the party school correspondence education.
sentences.chinese: 教学质量是党校函授教育的生命线。

sentences.english: Party School of C. P. C GuiYang Municipal Committee, 2nd Cadre Class of Spring 2010
sentences.chinese: 中共贵阳市委党校2010年春季县干二班。
